sentences.sContent: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.sContent_eng: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.sCn: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.sContent: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.sContent_eng: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.sCn: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.sContent: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.sContent_eng: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.sCn: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

phrases.pCn: n. 防风灯；飓风灯；马灯

remMethod.val: 飓风 (hurricane) 能够 (can) 一下子 (hurry) 把树木连根拔起

trans.tranOther: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water
